post.description:
Create a Cart. Although optional, specifying the cart's region and sales channel can affect the cart's pricing and
the products that can be added to the cart respectively. So, make sure to set those early on and change them if necessary, such as when the customer changes their region.

If a customer is logged in, make sure to pass its ID or email within the cart's details so that the cart is attached to the customer.

post.description:
Complete a cart and place an order or create a swap, based on the cart's type. This includes attempting to authorize the cart's payment.
If authorizing the payment requires more action, the cart will not be completed and the order will not be placed or the swap will not be created.

An idempotency key will be generated if none is provided in the header `Idempotency-Key` and added to
the response. If an error occurs during cart completion or the request is interrupted for any reason, the cart completion can be retried by passing the idempotency
key in the `Idempotency-Key` header.

externalDocs.description: Cart completion overview

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Cart ID.

x-codeSamples.label: JS Client
cURL
x-codeSamples.source: curl -X POST '{backend_url}/store/carts/{id}/complete'

200.description: If the payment of the cart was successfully authorized, but requires further action from the customer, the response body will contain the cart with an updated payment session. Otherwise, if the payment was authorized and the cart was successfully completed, the response body will contain either the newly created order or swap, depending on what the cart was created for.

get.description:
Retrieves a list of products. The products can be filtered by fields such as `id` or `q`. The products can also be sorted or paginated.
This API Route can also be used to retrieve a product by its handle.

For accurate and correct pricing of the products based on the customer's context, it's highly recommended to pass fields such as
`region_id`, `currency_code`, and `cart_id` when available.

Passing `sales_channel_id` ensures retrieving only products available in the specified sales channel.
You can alternatively use a publishable API key in the request header instead of passing a `sales_channel_id`.

externalDocs.description: How to retrieve a product by its handle

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: term used to search products' title, description, variant's title, variant's sku, and collection's title.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Filter by IDs.

parameters.name: sales_channel_id
parameters.description: Filter by sales channel IDs. When provided, only products available in the selected sales channels are retrieved. Alternatively, you can pass a publishable API key in the request header and this will have the same effect.

parameters.name: collection_id
parameters.description: Filter by product collection IDs. When provided, only products that belong to the specified product collections are retrieved.

parameters.name: type_id
parameters.description: Filter by product type IDs. When provided, only products that belong to the specified product types are retrieved.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filter by product tag IDs. When provided, only products that belong to the specified product tags are retrieved.

parameters.name: created_at

gte.description: filter by dates greater than or equal to this date

parameters.name: updated_at
parameters.description: Filter by an update date range.

lt.description: filter by dates less than this date

gt.description: filter by dates greater than this date

lte.description: filter by dates less than or equal to this date

gte.description: filter by dates greater than or equal to this date

parameters.name: category_id
parameters.description: Filter by product category IDs. When provided, only products that belong to the specified product categories are retrieved.

parameters.name: include_category_children

tags.name: Admin Apps Oauth
tags.description:
Some plugins may require to authenticate with third-party services and store authentication details, such as the authentication token. To do that, they can create an Oauth provider within the plugin that handles the authentication.
The Apps Oauth API Routes allows admins to manage and generate token for an app using its oauth provider.

tags.name: Admin Auth
tags.description:
Authentication API Routes allow admin users to manage their session, such as login or log out.
When an admin user is logged in, the cookie header is set indicating the admin's login session.

externalDocs.description: How to implement user profiles

tags.name: Admin Batch Jobs
tags.description:
A batch job is a task that is performed by the Medusa backend asynchronusly. For example, the Import Product feature is implemented using batch jobs.
Batch Job API Routes allow admins to manage the batch jobs and their state.

externalDocs.description: How to import products

tags.name: Admin Currencies
tags.description:
A store can use unlimited currencies, and each region must be associated with at least one currency.
Currencies are defined within the Medusa backend. Currency API Routes allow admins to list and update currencies.

externalDocs.description: How to manage currencies

tags.name: Admin Customers
tags.description: Customers can either be created when they register through the Store APIs, or created by the admin using the Admin APIs.

externalDocs.description: How to manage customers

tags.name: Admin Customer Groups
tags.description:
Customer Groups can be used to organize customers that share similar data or attributes into dedicated groups.
This can be useful for different purposes such as setting a different price for a specific customer group.

externalDocs.description: How to manage customer groups

tags.name: Admin Discounts
tags.description:
Admins can create discounts with conditions and rules, providing them with advanced settings for variety of cases.
The Discount API Routes can be used to manage discounts, their conditions, resources, and more.

externalDocs.description: How to manage discounts

tags.name: Admin Draft Orders
tags.description: A draft order is an order created manually by the admin. It allows admins to create orders without direct involvement from the customer.

externalDocs.description: How to manage draft orders

tags.name: Admin Gift Cards
tags.description:
Admins can create gift cards and send them directly to customers, specifying options like their balance, region, and more.
These gift cards are different than the saleable gift cards in a store, which are created and managed through Product API Routes.

externalDocs.description: How to manage gift cards

tags.name: Admin Inventory Items
tags.description: Inventory items, provided by the [Inventory Module](https://docs.medusajs.com/modules/multiwarehouse/inventory-module), can be used to manage the inventory of saleable items in your store.

externalDocs.description: How to manage inventory items

tags.name: Admin Invites
tags.description: An admin can invite new users to manage their team. This would allow new users to authenticate as admins and perform admin functionalities.

externalDocs.description: How to manage invites

tags.name: Admin Notes
tags.description: Notes are created by admins and can be associated with any resource. For example, an admin can add a note to an order for additional details or remarks.

tags.name: Admin Notifications
tags.description:
Notifications are sent to customers to inform them of new updates. For example, a notification can be sent to the customer when their order is place or its state is updated.
The notification's type, such as an email or SMS, is determined by the notification provider installed on the Medusa backend.

tags.name: Admin Orders
tags.description:
Orders are purchases made by customers, typically through a storefront using the Store API. Draft orders created by the admin are also transformed to an Order once the payment is captured.
Managing orders include managing fulfillment, payment, claims, reservations, and more.

externalDocs.description: How to manage orders

tags.name: Admin Order Edits
tags.description: An admin can edit an order to remove, add, or update an item's quantity. When an admin edits an order, they're stored as an `OrderEdit`.

externalDocs.description: How to edit an order

tags.name: Admin Payments
tags.description: A payment can be related to an order, swap, return, or more. It can be captured or refunded.

tags.name: Admin Payment Collections
tags.description: A payment collection is useful for managing additional payments, such as for Order Edits, or installment payments.

tags.name: Admin Price Lists
tags.description: A price list are special prices applied to products based on a set of conditions, such as customer group.

externalDocs.description: How to manage price lists

tags.name: Admin Products
tags.description: Products are saleable items in a store. This also includes [saleable gift cards](https://docs.medusajs.com/modules/gift-cards/admin/manage-gift-cards#manage-gift-card-product) in a store.

externalDocs.description: How to manage products

tags.name: Admin Product Categories
tags.description: Products can be categoriezed into categories. A product can be added into more than one category.

externalDocs.description: How to manage product categories

tags.name: Admin Product Collections
tags.description: A product collection is used to organize products for different purposes such as marketing or discount purposes. For example, you can create a Summer Collection.

tags.name: Admin Product Tags
tags.description:
Product tags are string values created when you create or update a product with a new tag.
Products can have more than one tag, and products can share tags. This allows admins to associate products to similar tags that can be used to filter products.

tags.name: Admin Product Types
tags.description:
Product types are string values created when you create or update a product with a new type.
Products can have one type, and products can share types. This allows admins to associate products with a type that can be used to filter products.

tags.name: Admin Product Variants
tags.description:
Product variants are the actual salable item in your store. Each variant is a combination of the different option values available on the product.
Product variants can be managed through the Products API Routes.

externalDocs.description: How to manage product variants

tags.name: Admin Publishable API Keys
tags.description:
Publishable API Keys can be used to scope Store API calls with an API key, determining what resources are retrieved when querying the API.
For example, a publishable API key can be associated with one or more sales channels. When it is passed in the header of a request to the List Product store API Route,
the sales channels are inferred from the key and only products associated with those sales channels are retrieved.
Admins can manage publishable API keys and their associated resources. Currently, only Sales Channels are supported as a resource.

externalDocs.description: How to manage publishable API keys

tags.name: Admin Reservations
tags.description:
Reservations, provided by the [Inventory Module](https://docs.medusajs.com/modules/multiwarehouse/inventory-module), are quantities of an item that are reserved, typically when an order is placed but not yet fulfilled.
Reservations can be associated with any resources, but commonly with line items of an order.

externalDocs.description: How to manage item allocations in orders

tags.name: Admin Regions
tags.description:
Regions are different countries or geographical regions that the commerce store serves customers in.
Admins can manage these regions, their providers, and more.

externalDocs.description: How to manage regions

tags.name: Admin Return Reasons
tags.description:
Return reasons are key-value pairs that are used to specify why an order return is being created.
Admins can manage available return reasons, and they can be used by both admins and customers when creating a return.

externalDocs.description: How to manage return reasons

tags.name: Admin Returns
tags.description:
A return can be created by a customer or an admin to return items in an order.
Admins can manage these returns and change their state.

externalDocs.description: How to manage returns

tags.name: Admin Sales Channels
tags.description:
A sales channel indicates a channel where products can be sold in. For example, a webshop or a mobile app.
Admins can manage sales channels and the products available in them.

externalDocs.description: How to manage sales channels

tags.name: Admin Shipping Options
tags.description:
A shipping option is used to define the available shipping methods during checkout or when creating a return.
Admins can create an unlimited number of shipping options, each associated with a shipping profile and fulfillment provider, among other resources.

externalDocs.description: Shipping Option architecture

tags.name: Admin Shipping Profiles
tags.description:
A shipping profile is used to group products that can be shipped in the same manner.
They are created by the admin and they're not associated with a fulfillment provider.

externalDocs.description: Shipping Profile architecture

tags.name: Admin Stock Locations
tags.description:
A stock location, provided by the [Stock Location module](https://docs.medusajs.com/modules/multiwarehouse/stock-location-module), indicates a physical address that stock-kept items, such as physical products, can be stored in.
An admin can create and manage available stock locations.

externalDocs.description: How to manage stock locations.

tags.name: Admin Store
tags.description:
A store indicates the general configurations and details about the commerce store. By default, there's only one store in the Medusa backend.
Admins can manage the store and its details or configurations.

tags.name: Admin Swaps
tags.description:
A swap is created by a customer or an admin to exchange an item with a new one.
Creating a swap implicitely includes creating a return for the item being exchanged.

externalDocs.description: How to manage swaps

tags.name: Admin Tax Rates
tags.description: Each region has at least a default tax rate. Admins can create and manage additional tax rates that can be applied for certain conditions, such as for specific product types.

externalDocs.description: How to manage tax rates

tags.name: Admin Uploads
tags.description: The upload API Routes are used to upload any type of resources. For example, they can be used to upload CSV files that are used to import products into the store.

externalDocs.description: How to upload CSV file when importing a product.

tags.name: Admin Users
tags.description: A store can have more than one user, each having the same privileges. Admins can manage users, their passwords, and more.

externalDocs.description: How to manage users

tags.name: Store Auth
tags.description:
Authentication API Routes allow you to manage a customer's session, such as login or log out.
You can send authenticated requests for a customer either using the Cookie header or using the JWT Token.

externalDocs.description: How to implement customer profiles in your storefront

tags.name: Store Carts
tags.description:
A cart is a virtual shopping bag that customers can use to add items they want to purchase.
A cart is then used to checkout and place an order.

externalDocs.description: How to implement cart functionality in your storefront

tags.name: Store Customers
tags.description: A customer can register and manage their information such as addresses, orders, payment methods, and more.

externalDocs.description: How to implement customer profiles in your storefront

tags.name: Store Gift Cards
tags.description:
Customers can use gift cards during checkout to deduct the gift card's balance from the checkout total.
The Gift Card API Routes allow retrieving a gift card's details by its code. A gift card can be applied to a cart using the Carts API Routes.

externalDocs.description: How to use gift cards in a storefront

tags.name: Store Orders
tags.description:
Orders are purchases made by customers, typically through a storefront.
Orders are placed and created using the Carts API Routes. The Orders API Routes allow retrieving and claiming orders.

externalDocs.description: How to retrieve order details in a storefront

tags.name: Store Order Edits
tags.description:
Order edits are changes made to items in an order such as adding, updating their quantity, or deleting them. Order edits are created by the admin.
A customer can review order edit requests created by an admin and confirm or decline them.

externalDocs.description: How to handle order edits in a storefront

tags.name: Store Payment Collections
tags.description: A payment collection is useful for managing additional payments, such as for Order Edits, or installment payments.

tags.name: Store Products
tags.description:
Products are saleable items in a store. This also includes [saleable gift cards](https://docs.medusajs.com/modules/gift-cards/storefront/use-gift-cards) in a store.
Using these API Routes, you can filter products by categories, collections, sales channels, and more.

externalDocs.description: How to show products in a storefront

tags.name: Store Product Variants
tags.description: Product variants are the actual salable item in your store. Each variant is a combination of the different option values available on the product.

tags.name: Store Product Categories
tags.description:
Products can be categoriezed into categories. A product can be associated more than one category.
Using these API Routes, you can list or retrieve a category's details and products.

externalDocs.description: How to use product categories in a storefront

tags.name: Store Product Collections
tags.description:
A product collection is used to organize products for different purposes such as marketing or discount purposes. For example, you can create a Summer Collection.
Using these API Routes, you can list or retrieve a collection's details and products.

tags.name: Store Product Tags
tags.description:
Product tags are string values that can be used to filter products by.
Products can have more than one tag, and products can share tags.

tags.name: Store Product Types
tags.description:
Product types are string values that can be used to filter products by.
Products can have more than one tag, and products can share types.

tags.name: Store Regions
tags.description:
Regions are different countries or geographical regions that the commerce store serves customers in.
Customers can choose what region they're in, which can be used to change the prices shown based on the region and its currency.

externalDocs.description: How to use regions in a storefront

tags.name: Store Returns
tags.description: A return can be created by a customer to return items in an order.

externalDocs.description: How to create a return in a storefront

tags.name: Store Return Reasons
tags.description: Return reasons are key-value pairs that are used to specify why an order return is being created.

tags.name: Store Shipping Options
tags.description: A shipping option is used to define the available shipping methods during checkout or when creating a return.

externalDocs.description: Shipping Option architecture

tags.name: Store Swaps
tags.description:
A swap is created by a customer or an admin to exchange an item with a new one.
Creating a swap implicitely includes creating a return for the item being exchanged.

externalDocs.description: How to create a swap in a storefront

parent_discount.description: The details of the parent discount that this discount was created from.

starts_at.description: The time at which the discount can be used.

ends_at.description: The time at which the discount can no longer be used.

regions.description: The details of the regions in which the Discount can be used.

usage_limit.description: The maximum number of times that a discount can be used.

usage_count.description: The number of times a discount has been used.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

deleted_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was deleted.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

DiscountCondition.title: Discount Condition
DiscountCondition.description: Holds rule conditions for when a discount is applicable

type.description: The type of the condition. The type affects the available resources associated with the condition. For example, if the type is `products`, that means the `products` relation will hold the products associated with this condition and other relations will be empty.

operator.description: The operator of the condition. `in` indicates that discountable resources are within the specified resources. `not_in` indicates that discountable resources are everything but the specified resources.

discount_rule_id.description: The ID of the discount rule associated with the condition

discount_rule.description: The details of the discount rule associated with the condition.

products.description: products associated with this condition if `type` is `products`.

product_types.description: Product types associated with this condition if `type` is `product_types`.

product_tags.description: Product tags associated with this condition if `type` is `product_tags`.

product_collections.description: Product collections associated with this condition if `type` is `product_collections`.

customer_groups.description: Customer groups associated with this condition if `type` is `customer_groups`.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

deleted_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was deleted.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

DiscountConditionCustomerGroup.title: Product Tag Discount Condition
DiscountConditionCustomerGroup.description: Associates a discount condition with a customer group

customer_group_id.description: The ID of the Product Tag

condition_id.description: The ID of the Discount Condition

customer_group.description: Available if the relation `customer_group` is expanded.

discount_condition.description: Available if the relation `discount_condition` is expanded.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

DiscountConditionProduct.title: Product Discount Condition
DiscountConditionProduct.description: This represents the association between a discount condition and a product

product_id.description: The ID of the Product Tag

condition_id.description: The ID of the Discount Condition

discount_condition.description: The details of the discount condition.

DiscountConditionProductCollection.description: This represents the association between a discount condition and a product collection

product_collection_id.description: The ID of the Product Collection

condition_id.description: The ID of the Discount Condition

product_collection.description: The details of the product collection.

discount_condition.description: The details of the discount condition.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

DiscountConditionProductTag.description: This represents the association between a discount condition and a product tag

condition_id.description: The ID of the Discount Condition

product_tag.description: The details of the product tag.

DiscountConditionProductType.title: Product Type Discount Condition
DiscountConditionProductType.description: This represents the association between a discount condition and a product type

product_type_id.description: The ID of the Product Tag

condition_id.description: The ID of the Discount Condition

product_type.description: The details of the product type.

discount_condition.description: The details of the discount condition.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

DiscountRule.title: Discount Rule
DiscountRule.description: A discount rule defines how a Discount is calculated when applied to a Cart.

type.description: The type of the Discount, can be `fixed` for discounts that reduce the price by a fixed amount, `percentage` for percentage reductions or `free_shipping` for shipping vouchers.

description.description: A short description of the discount

value.description: The value that the discount represents; this will depend on the type of the discount

allocation.description: The scope that the discount should apply to.

conditions.description: The details of the discount conditions associated with the rule. They can be used to limit when the discount can be used.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

deleted_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was deleted.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

DraftOrder.title: DraftOrder
DraftOrder.description: A draft order is created by an admin without direct involvement of the customer. Once its payment is marked as captured, it is transformed into an order.

status.description: The status of the draft order. It's changed to `completed` when it's transformed to an order.

cart_id.description: The ID of the cart associated with the draft order.

cart.description: The details of the cart associated with the draft order.

order_id.description: The ID of the order created from the draft order when its payment is captured.

order.description: The details of the order created from the draft order when its payment is captured.

canceled_at.description: The date the draft order was canceled at.

completed_at.description: The date the draft order was completed at.

no_notification_order.description: Whether to send the customer notifications regarding order updates.

idempotency_key.description: Randomly generated key used to continue the completion of the cart associated with the draft order in case of failure.

externalDocs.description: Learn more how to use the idempotency key.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

code.description: A slug code to indicate the type of the error.

message.description: Description of the error that occurred.

type.description: A slug indicating the type of the error.

line_item.description: The line item associated with the reservation.

inventory_item.description: The inventory item associated with the reservation.

feature_flags.description: The feature flags enabled in the store's backend.

modules.description: The modules installed in the store's backend.

key.description: The key of the feature flag.

value.description: The value of the feature flag.

Fulfillment.title: Fulfillment
Fulfillment.description: A Fulfillment is created once an admin can prepare the purchased goods. Fulfillments will eventually be shipped and hold information about how to track shipments. Fulfillments are created through a fulfillment provider, which typically integrates a third-party shipping service. Fulfillments can be associated with orders, claims, swaps, and returns.

claim_order_id.description: The ID of the Claim that the Fulfillment belongs to.

claim_order.description: The details of the claim that the fulfillment may belong to.

swap_id.description: The ID of the Swap that the Fulfillment belongs to.

swap.description: The details of the swap that the fulfillment may belong to.

order_id.description: The ID of the Order that the Fulfillment belongs to.

order.description: The details of the order that the fulfillment may belong to.

provider_id.description: The ID of the Fulfillment Provider responsible for handling the fulfillment.

provider.description: The details of the fulfillment provider responsible for handling the fulfillment.

location_id.description: The ID of the stock location the fulfillment will be shipped from

items.description: The Fulfillment Items in the Fulfillment. These hold information about how many of each Line Item has been fulfilled.

tracking_links.description: The Tracking Links that can be used to track the status of the Fulfillment. These will usually be provided by the Fulfillment Provider.

tracking_numbers.description: The tracking numbers that can be used to track the status of the fulfillment.

data.description: This contains all the data necessary for the Fulfillment provider to handle the fulfillment.

shipped_at.description: The date with timezone at which the Fulfillment was shipped.

no_notification.description: Flag for describing whether or not notifications related to this should be sent.

canceled_at.description: The date with timezone at which the Fulfillment was canceled.

idempotency_key.description: Randomly generated key used to continue the completion of the fulfillment in case of failure.

externalDocs.description: Learn more how to use the idempotency key.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

FulfillmentItem.title: Fulfillment Item
FulfillmentItem.description: This represents the association between a Line Item and a Fulfillment.

fulfillment_id.description: The ID of the Fulfillment that the Fulfillment Item belongs to.

item_id.description: The ID of the Line Item that the Fulfillment Item references.

item.description: The details of the line item.

quantity.description: The quantity of the Line Item that is included in the Fulfillment.

FulfillmentProvider.title: Fulfillment Provider
FulfillmentProvider.description: A fulfillment provider represents a fulfillment service installed in the Medusa backend, either through a plugin or backend customizations. It holds the fulfillment service's installation status.

id.description: The ID of the fulfillment provider as given by the fulfillment service.

is_installed.description: Whether the fulfillment service is installed in the current version. If a fulfillment service is no longer installed, the `is_installed` attribute is set to `false`.

GiftCard.title: Gift Card
GiftCard.description: Gift Cards are redeemable and represent a value that can be used towards the payment of an Order.

code.description: The unique code that identifies the Gift Card. This is used by the Customer to redeem the value of the Gift Card.

value.description: The value that the Gift Card represents.

balance.description: The remaining value on the Gift Card.

region_id.description: The ID of the region this gift card is available in.

region.description: The details of the region this gift card is available in.

order_id.description: The ID of the order that the gift card was purchased in.

order.description: The details of the order that the gift card was purchased in.

is_disabled.description: Whether the Gift Card has been disabled. Disabled Gift Cards cannot be applied to carts.

ends_at.description: The time at which the Gift Card can no longer be used.

tax_rate.description: The gift card's tax rate that will be applied on calculating totals

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

deleted_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was deleted.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

GiftCardTransaction.title: Gift Card Transaction
GiftCardTransaction.description: Gift Card Transactions are created once a Customer uses a Gift Card to pay for their Order.

gift_card_id.description: The ID of the Gift Card that was used in the transaction.

gift_card.description: The details of the gift card associated used in this transaction.

order_id.description: The ID of the order that the gift card was used for payment.

order.description: The details of the order that the gift card was used for payment.

amount.description: The amount that was used from the Gift Card.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

is_taxable.description: Whether the transaction is taxable or not.

tax_rate.description: The tax rate of the transaction

IdempotencyKey.title: Idempotency Key
IdempotencyKey.description: Idempotency Key is used to continue a process in case of any failure that might occur.

idempotency_key.description: The unique randomly generated key used to determine the state of a process.

externalDocs.description: Learn more how to use the idempotency key.

created_at.description: Date which the idempotency key was locked.

locked_at.description: Date which the idempotency key was locked.

request_params.description: The parameters passed to the request

Image.title: Image
Image.description: An Image is used to store details about uploaded images. Images are uploaded by the File Service, and the URL is provided by the File Service.

url.description: The URL at which the image file can be found.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

deleted_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was deleted.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

sku.description: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU) code of the Inventory Item.

hs_code.description: The Harmonized System code of the Inventory Item. May be used by Fulfillment Providers to pass customs information to shipping carriers.

origin_country.description: The country in which the Inventory Item was produced. May be used by Fulfillment Providers to pass customs information to shipping carriers.

mid_code.description: The Manufacturers Identification code that identifies the manufacturer of the Inventory Item. May be used by Fulfillment Providers to pass customs information to shipping carriers.

title.description: Title of the inventory item

material.description: The material and composition that the Inventory Item is made of, May be used by Fulfillment Providers to pass customs information to shipping carriers.

weight.description: The weight of the Inventory Item. May be used in shipping rate calculations.

height.description: The height of the Inventory Item. May be used in shipping rate calculations.

width.description: The width of the Inventory Item. May be used in shipping rate calculations.

length.description: The length of the Inventory Item. May be used in shipping rate calculations.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

deleted_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was deleted.

stocked_quantity.description: the total stock quantity of an inventory item at the given location ID

reserved_quantity.description: the reserved stock quantity of an inventory item at the given location ID

incoming_quantity.description: the incoming stock quantity of an inventory item at the given location ID

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

deleted_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was deleted.

Invite.title: Invite
Invite.description: An invite is created when an admin user invites a new user to join the store's team. Once the invite is accepted, it's deleted.

user_email.description: The email of the user being invited.

role.description: The user's role. These roles don't change the privileges of the user.

accepted.description: Whether the invite was accepted or not.

token.description: The token used to accept the invite.

expires_at.description: The date the invite expires at.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

deleted_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was deleted.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

LineItem.title: Line Item
LineItem.description: Line Items are created when a product is added to a Cart. When Line Items are purchased they will get copied to the resulting order, swap, or claim, and can eventually be referenced in Fulfillments and Returns. Line items may also be used for order edits.

cart_id.description: The ID of the cart that the line item may belongs to.

cart.description: The details of the cart that the line item may belongs to.

order_id.description: The ID of the order that the line item may belongs to.

order.description: The details of the order that the line item may belongs to.

swap_id.description: The ID of the swap that the line item may belong to.

swap.description: The details of the swap that the line item may belong to.

claim_order_id.description: The ID of the claim that the line item may belong to.

claim_order.description: The details of the claim that the line item may belong to.

tax_lines.description: The details of the item's tax lines.

adjustments.description: The details of the item's adjustments, which are available when a discount is applied on the item.

original_item_id.description: The ID of the original line item. This is useful if the line item belongs to a resource that references an order, such as a return or an order edit.

order_edit_id.description: The ID of the order edit that the item may belong to.

order_edit.description: The details of the order edit.

title.description: The title of the Line Item.

description.description: A more detailed description of the contents of the Line Item.

thumbnail.description: A URL string to a small image of the contents of the Line Item.

is_giftcard.description: Flag to indicate if the Line Item is a Gift Card.

should_merge.description: Flag to indicate if new Line Items with the same variant should be merged or added as an additional Line Item.

allow_discounts.description: Flag to indicate if the Line Item should be included when doing discount calculations.

has_shipping.description: Flag to indicate if the Line Item has fulfillment associated with it.

unit_price.description: The price of one unit of the content in the Line Item. This should be in the currency defined by the Cart/Order/Swap/Claim that the Line Item belongs to.

variant_id.description: The id of the Product Variant contained in the Line Item.

variant.description: The details of the product variant that this item was created from.

quantity.description: The quantity of the content in the Line Item.

fulfilled_quantity.description: The quantity of the Line Item that has been fulfilled.

returned_quantity.description: The quantity of the Line Item that has been returned.

shipped_quantity.description: The quantity of the Line Item that has been shipped.

refundable.description: The amount that can be refunded from the given Line Item. Takes taxes and discounts into consideration.

subtotal.description: The subtotal of the line item

tax_total.description: The total of tax of the line item

total.description: The total amount of the line item

original_total.description: The original total amount of the line item

original_tax_total.description: The original tax total amount of the line item

discount_total.description: The total of discount of the line item rounded

raw_discount_total.description: The total of discount of the line item

gift_card_total.description: The total of the gift card of the line item

includes_tax.description: Indicates if the line item unit_price include tax

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

LineItemAdjustment.title: Line Item Adjustment
LineItemAdjustment.description: A Line Item Adjustment includes details on discounts applied on a line item.

item_id.description: The ID of the line item

item.description: The details of the line item.

discount_id.description: The ID of the discount associated with the adjustment

discount.description: The details of the discount associated with the adjustment.

amount.description: The adjustment amount

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

LineItemTaxLine.title: Line Item Tax Line
LineItemTaxLine.description: A Line Item Tax Line represents the taxes applied on a line item.

id.description: The line item tax line's ID

code.description: A code to identify the tax type by

name.description: A human friendly name for the tax

rate.description: The numeric rate to charge tax by

item_id.description: The ID of the line item

item.description: The details of the line item.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

resolution.description: The resolution path of the module or false if module is not installed.

MoneyAmount.title: Money Amount
MoneyAmount.description: A Money Amount represent a price amount, for example, a product variant's price or a price in a price list. Each Money Amount either has a Currency or Region associated with it to indicate the pricing in a given Currency or, for fully region-based pricing, the given price in a specific Region. If region-based pricing is used, the amount will be in the currency defined for the Region.

currency_code.description: The 3 character currency code that the money amount may belong to.

externalDocs.description: See a list of codes.

currency.description: The details of the currency that the money amount may belong to.

amount.description: The amount in the smallest currecny unit (e.g. cents 100 cents to charge $1) that the Product Variant will cost.

min_quantity.description: The minimum quantity that the Money Amount applies to. If this value is not set, the Money Amount applies to all quantities.

max_quantity.description: The maximum quantity that the Money Amount applies to. If this value is not set, the Money Amount applies to all quantities.

price_list_id.description: The ID of the price list that the money amount may belong to.

price_list.description: The details of the price list that the money amount may belong to.

variant_id.description: The ID of the Product Variant contained in the Line Item.

variant.description: The details of the product variant that the money amount may belong to.

region_id.description: The region's ID

region.description: The details of the region that the money amount may belong to.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

deleted_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was deleted.

message.default: Provided request body contains errors. Please check the data and retry the request

Note.title: Note
Note.description: A Note is an element that can be used in association with different resources to allow admin users to describe additional information. For example, they can be used to add additional information about orders.

resource_type.description: The type of resource that the Note refers to.

resource_id.description: The ID of the resource that the Note refers to.

value.description: The contents of the note.
value.example: This order must be fulfilled on Monday

author_id.description: The ID of the user that created the note.

author.description: The details of the user that created the note.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

deleted_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was deleted.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

Notification.title: Notification
Notification.description: A notification is an alert sent, typically to customers, using the installed Notification Provider as a reaction to internal events such as `order.placed`. Notifications can be resent.

event_name.description: The name of the event that the notification was sent for.

resource_type.description: The type of resource that the Notification refers to.

resource_id.description: The ID of the resource that the Notification refers to.

customer_id.description: The ID of the customer that this notification was sent to.

customer.description: The details of the customer that this notification was sent to.

to.description: The address that the Notification was sent to. This will usually be an email address, but can represent other addresses such as a chat bot user ID.

data.description: The data that the Notification was sent with. This contains all the data necessary for the Notification Provider to initiate a resend.

parent_notification.description: The details of the parent notification.

resends.description: The details of all resends of the notification.

provider_id.description: The ID of the notification provider used to send the notification.

provider.description: The notification provider used to send the notification.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

NotificationProvider.title: Notification Provider
NotificationProvider.description: A notification provider represents a notification service installed in the Medusa backend, either through a plugin or backend customizations. It holds the notification service's installation status.

id.description: The ID of the notification provider as given by the notification service.

is_installed.description: Whether the notification service is installed in the current version. If a notification service is no longer installed, the `is_installed` attribute is set to `false`.

OAuth.title: OAuth
OAuth.description: An Oauth app is typically created by a plugin to handle authentication to third-party services.

install_url.description: The URL to install the app

uninstall_url.description: The URL to uninstall the app

data.description: Any data necessary to the app.

Order.title: Order
Order.description: An order is a purchase made by a customer. It holds details about payment and fulfillment of the order. An order may also be created from a draft order, which is created by an admin user.

cart_id.description: The ID of the cart associated with the order

cart.description: The details of the cart associated with the order.

customer_id.description: The ID of the customer associated with the order

customer.description: The details of the customer associated with the order.

email.description: The email associated with the order

billing_address_id.description: The ID of the billing address associated with the order

billing_address.description: The details of the billing address associated with the order.

shipping_address_id.description: The ID of the shipping address associated with the order

shipping_address.description: The details of the shipping address associated with the order.

region_id.description: The ID of the region this order was created in.

region.description: The details of the region this order was created in.

currency_code.description: The 3 character currency code that is used in the order

externalDocs.description: See a list of codes.

currency.description: The details of the currency used in the order.

discounts.description: The details of the discounts applied on the order.

gift_cards.description: The details of the gift card used in the order.

shipping_methods.description: The details of the shipping methods used in the order.

payments.description: The details of the payments used in the order.

fulfillments.description: The details of the fulfillments created for the order.

returns.description: The details of the returns created for the order.

claims.description: The details of the claims created for the order.

refunds.description: The details of the refunds created for the order.

swaps.description: The details of the swaps created for the order.

draft_order_id.description: The ID of the draft order this order was created from.

draft_order.description: The details of the draft order this order was created from.

items.description: The details of the line items that belong to the order.

edits.description: The details of the order edits done on the order.

gift_card_transactions.description: The gift card transactions made in the order.

canceled_at.description: The date the order was canceled on.

no_notification.description: Flag for describing whether or not notifications related to this should be send.

idempotency_key.description: Randomly generated key used to continue the processing of the order in case of failure.

externalDocs.description: Learn more how to use the idempotency key.

external_id.description: The ID of an external order.

sales_channel_id.description: The ID of the sales channel this order belongs to.

sales_channel.description: The details of the sales channel this order belongs to.

shipping_tax_total.description: The tax total applied on shipping

item_tax_total.description: The tax total applied on items

refunded_total.description: The total amount refunded if the order is returned.

total.description: The total amount of the order

refundable_amount.description: The amount that can be refunded

gift_card_tax_total.description: The total of gift cards with taxes

returnable_items.description: The details of the line items that are returnable as part of the order, swaps, or claims

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

OrderEdit.title: Order Edit
OrderEdit.description: Order edit allows modifying items in an order, such as adding, updating, or deleting items from the original order. Once the order edit is confirmed, the changes are reflected on the original order.

order_id.description: The ID of the order that is edited

order.description: The details of the order that this order edit was created for.

changes.description: The details of all the changes on the original order's line items.

internal_note.description: An optional note with additional details about the order edit.
internal_note.example: Included two more items B to the order.

created_by.description: The unique identifier of the user or customer who created the order edit.

requested_by.description: The unique identifier of the user or customer who requested the order edit.

requested_at.description: The date with timezone at which the edit was requested.

confirmed_by.description: The unique identifier of the user or customer who confirmed the order edit.

confirmed_at.description: The date with timezone at which the edit was confirmed.

declined_by.description: The unique identifier of the user or customer who declined the order edit.

declined_at.description: The date with timezone at which the edit was declined.

declined_reason.description: An optional note why  the order edit is declined.

canceled_by.description: The unique identifier of the user or customer who cancelled the order edit.

canceled_at.description: The date with timezone at which the edit was cancelled.

shipping_total.description: The total of the shipping amount

gift_card_total.description: The total of the gift card amount

gift_card_tax_total.description: The total of the gift card tax amount

total.description: The total amount of the edited order.

difference_due.description: The difference between the total amount of the order and total amount of edited order.

status.description: The status of the order edit.

items.description: The details of the cloned items from the original order with the new changes. Once the order edit is confirmed, these line items are associated with the original order.

payment_collection_id.description: The ID of the payment collection

payment_collection.description: The details of the payment collection used to authorize additional payment if necessary.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

OrderItemChange.title: Order Item Change
OrderItemChange.description: An order item change is a change made within an order edit to an order's items. These changes are not reflected on the original order until the order edit is confirmed.

type.description: The order item change's status

order_edit_id.description: The ID of the order edit

order_edit.description: The details of the order edit the item change is associated with.

original_line_item_id.description: The ID of the original line item in the order

original_line_item.description: The details of the original line item this item change references. This is used if the item change updates or deletes the original item.

line_item_id.description: The ID of the cloned line item.

line_item.description: The details of the resulting line item after the item change. This line item is then used in the original order once the order edit is confirmed.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

deleted_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was deleted.

Payment.title: Payment
Payment.description: A payment is originally created from a payment session. Once a payment session is authorized, the payment is created to represent the authorized amount with a given payment method. Payments can be captured, canceled or refunded. Payments can be made towards orders, swaps, order edits, or other resources.

swap_id.description: The ID of the swap that this payment was potentially created for.

swap.description: The details of the swap that this payment was potentially created for.

cart_id.description: The ID of the cart that the payment session was potentially created for.

cart.description: The details of the cart that the payment session was potentially created for.

order_id.description: The ID of the order that the payment session was potentially created for.

order.description: The details of the order that the payment session was potentially created for.

amount.description: The amount that the Payment has been authorized for.

currency_code.description: The 3 character ISO currency code of the payment.

externalDocs.description: See a list of codes.

currency.description: The details of the currency of the payment.

amount_refunded.description: The amount of the original Payment amount that has been refunded back to the Customer.

provider_id.description: The id of the Payment Provider that is responsible for the Payment

data.description: The data required for the Payment Provider to identify, modify and process the Payment. Typically this will be an object that holds an id to the external payment session, but can be an empty object if the Payment Provider doesn't hold any state.

captured_at.description: The date with timezone at which the Payment was captured.

canceled_at.description: The date with timezone at which the Payment was canceled.

idempotency_key.description: Randomly generated key used to continue the completion of a payment in case of failure.

externalDocs.description: Learn more how to use the idempotency key.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

PaymentCollection.title: Payment Collection
PaymentCollection.description: A payment collection allows grouping and managing a list of payments at one. This can be helpful when making additional payment for order edits or integrating installment payments.

type.description: The type of the payment collection

status.description: The type of the payment collection

amount.description: Amount of the payment collection.

authorized_amount.description: Authorized amount of the payment collection.

region_id.description: The ID of the region this payment collection is associated with.

region.description: The details of the region this payment collection is associated with.

currency_code.description: The three character ISO code for the currency this payment collection is associated with.

externalDocs.description: See a list of codes.

currency.description: The details of the currency this payment collection is associated with.

payment_sessions.description: The details of the payment sessions created as part of the payment collection.

payments.description: The details of the payments created as part of the payment collection.

created_by.description: The ID of the user that created the payment collection.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

deleted_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was deleted.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

PaymentProvider.title: Payment Provider
PaymentProvider.description: A payment provider represents a payment service installed in the Medusa backend, either through a plugin or backend customizations. It holds the payment service's installation status.

id.description: The ID of the payment provider as given by the payment service.

is_installed.description: Whether the payment service is installed in the current version. If a payment service is no longer installed, the `is_installed` attribute is set to `false`.

PaymentSession.title: Payment Session
PaymentSession.description: A Payment Session is created when a Customer initilizes the checkout flow, and can be used to hold the state of a payment flow. Each Payment Session is controlled by a Payment Provider, which is responsible for the communication with external payment services. Authorized Payment Sessions will eventually get promoted to Payments to indicate that they are authorized for payment processing such as capture or refund. Payment sessions can also be used as part of payment collections.

cart_id.description: The ID of the cart that the payment session was created for.

cart.description: The details of the cart that the payment session was created for.

provider_id.description: The ID of the Payment Provider that is responsible for the Payment Session

is_selected.description: A flag to indicate if the Payment Session has been selected as the method that will be used to complete the purchase.

is_initiated.description: A flag to indicate if a communication with the third party provider has been initiated.

status.description: Indicates the status of the Payment Session. Will default to `pending`, and will eventually become `authorized`. Payment Sessions may have the status of `requires_more` to indicate that further actions are to be completed by the Customer.

data.description: The data required for the Payment Provider to identify, modify and process the Payment Session. Typically this will be an object that holds an id to the external payment session, but can be an empty object if the Payment Provider doesn't hold any state.

idempotency_key.description: Randomly generated key used to continue the completion of a cart in case of failure.

externalDocs.description: Learn more how to use the idempotency key.

amount.description: The amount that the Payment Session has been authorized for.

payment_authorized_at.description: The date with timezone at which the Payment Session was authorized.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

PriceList.title: Price List
PriceList.description: A Price List represents a set of prices that override the default price for one or more product variants.

name.description: The price list's name

type.description: The type of Price List. This can be one of either `sale` or `override`.

status.description: The status of the Price List

starts_at.description: The date with timezone that the Price List starts being valid.

ends_at.description: The date with timezone that the Price List stops being valid.

customer_groups.description: The details of the customer groups that the Price List can apply to.

prices.description: The prices that belong to the price list, represented as a Money Amount.

includes_tax.description: Whether the price list prices include tax

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

deleted_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was deleted.

variants.description: The product variants and their prices.

tax_rates.description: An array of applied tax rates

name.description: The name of the tax rate

code.description: The code of the tax rate

original_price.description: The original price of the variant without any discounted prices applied.

calculated_price.description: The calculated price of the variant. Can be a discounted price.

original_price_incl_tax.description: The original price of the variant including taxes.

calculated_price_incl_tax.description: The calculated price of the variant including taxes.

original_tax.description: The taxes applied on the original price.

calculated_tax.description: The taxes applied on the calculated price.

tax_rates.description: An array of applied tax rates

name.description: The name of the tax rate

code.description: The code of the tax rate

Product.title: Product
Product.description: A product is a saleable item that holds general information such as name or description. It must include at least one Product Variant, where each product variant defines different options to purchase the product with (for example, different sizes or colors). The prices and inventory of the product are defined on the variant level.

title.description: A title that can be displayed for easy identification of the Product.

subtitle.description: An optional subtitle that can be used to further specify the Product.

description.description: A short description of the Product.

handle.description: A unique identifier for the Product (e.g. for slug structure).

is_giftcard.description: Whether the Product represents a Gift Card. Products that represent Gift Cards will automatically generate a redeemable Gift Card code once they are purchased.

images.description: The details of the product's images.

thumbnail.description: A URL to an image file that can be used to identify the Product.

options.description: The details of the Product Options that are defined for the Product. The product's variants will have a unique combination of values of the product's options.

variants.description: The details of the Product Variants that belong to the Product. Each will have a unique combination of values of the product's options.

categories.description: The details of the product categories that this product belongs to.

profile_id.description: The ID of the shipping profile that the product belongs to. The shipping profile has a set of defined shipping options that can be used to fulfill the product.

profile.description: The details of the shipping profile that the product belongs to. The shipping profile has a set of defined shipping options that can be used to fulfill the product.

profiles.description: Available if the relation `profiles` is expanded.

weight.description: The weight of the Product Variant. May be used in shipping rate calculations.

length.description: The length of the Product Variant. May be used in shipping rate calculations.

height.description: The height of the Product Variant. May be used in shipping rate calculations.

width.description: The width of the Product Variant. May be used in shipping rate calculations.

hs_code.description: The Harmonized System code of the Product Variant. May be used by Fulfillment Providers to pass customs information to shipping carriers.

origin_country.description: The country in which the Product Variant was produced. May be used by Fulfillment Providers to pass customs information to shipping carriers.

mid_code.description: The Manufacturers Identification code that identifies the manufacturer of the Product Variant. May be used by Fulfillment Providers to pass customs information to shipping carriers.

material.description: The material and composition that the Product Variant is made of, May be used by Fulfillment Providers to pass customs information to shipping carriers.

collection_id.description: The ID of the product collection that the product belongs to.

collection.description: The details of the product collection that the product belongs to.

type_id.description: The ID of the product type that the product belongs to.

type.description: The details of the product type that the product belongs to.

tags.description: The details of the product tags used in this product.

discountable.description: Whether the Product can be discounted. Discounts will not apply to Line Items of this Product when this flag is set to `false`.

external_id.description: The external ID of the product

sales_channels.description: The details of the sales channels this product is available in.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

deleted_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was deleted.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

ProductCategory.title: Product Category
ProductCategory.description: A product category can be used to categorize products into a hierarchy of categories.

name.description: The product category's name

handle.description: A unique string that identifies the Product Category - can for example be used in slug structures.

mpath.description: A string for Materialized Paths - used for finding ancestors and descendents

is_internal.description: A flag to make product category an internal category for admins

is_active.description: A flag to make product category visible/hidden in the store front

rank.description: An integer that depicts the rank of category in a tree node

category_children.description: The details of the category's children.

parent_category_id.description: The ID of the parent category.

parent_category.description: The details of the parent of this category.

products.description: The details of the products that belong to this category.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

ProductCollection.title: Product Collection
ProductCollection.description: A Product Collection allows grouping together products for promotional purposes. For example, an admin can create a Summer collection, add products to it, and showcase it on the storefront.

title.description: The title that the Product Collection is identified by.

handle.description: A unique string that identifies the Product Collection - can for example be used in slug structures.

products.description: The details of the products that belong to this product collection.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

deleted_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was deleted.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

ProductOption.title: Product Option
ProductOption.description: A Product Option defines properties that may vary between different variants of a Product. Common Product Options are "Size" and "Color". Admins are free to create any product options.

title.description: The title that the Product Option is defined by (e.g. `Size`).

values.description: The details of the values of the product option.

product_id.description: The ID of the product that this product option belongs to.

product.description: The details of the product that this product option belongs to.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

deleted_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was deleted.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

ProductOptionValue.title: Product Option Value
ProductOptionValue.description: An option value is one of the possible values of a Product Option. Product Variants specify a unique combination of product option values.

value.description: The value that the Product Variant has defined for the specific Product Option (e.g. if the Product Option is "Size" this value could be `Small`, `Medium` or `Large`).

option_id.description: The ID of the Product Option that the Product Option Value belongs to.

option.description: The details of the product option that the Product Option Value belongs to.

variant_id.description: The ID of the product variant that uses this product option value.

variant.description: The details of the product variant that uses this product option value.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

ProductTag.title: Product Tag
ProductTag.description: A Product Tag can be added to Products for easy filtering and grouping.

value.description: The value that the Product Tag represents

ProductTaxRate.title: Product Tax Rate
ProductTaxRate.description: This represents the association between a tax rate and a product to indicate that the product is taxed in a way different than the default.

rate_id.description: The ID of the Tax Rate

tax_rate.description: The details of the tax rate.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

ProductType.title: Product Type
ProductType.description: A Product Type can be added to Products for filtering and reporting purposes.

value.description: The value that the Product Type represents.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

deleted_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was deleted.
