externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

ProductTypeTaxRate.title: Product Type Tax Rate
ProductTypeTaxRate.description: This represents the association between a tax rate and a product type to indicate that the product type is taxed in a different way than the default.

product_type_id.description: The ID of the Product type

product_type.description: The details of the product type.

rate_id.description: The id of the Tax Rate

tax_rate.description: The details of the tax rate.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

ProductVariant.title: Product Variant
ProductVariant.description: A Product Variant represents a Product with a specific set of Product Option configurations. The maximum number of Product Variants that a Product can have is given by the number of available Product Option combinations. A product must at least have one product variant.

title.description: A title that can be displayed for easy identification of the Product Variant.

product_id.description: The ID of the product that the product variant belongs to.

product.description: The details of the product that the product variant belongs to.

prices.description: The details of the prices of the Product Variant, each represented as a Money Amount. Each Money Amount represents a price in a given currency or a specific Region.

sku.description: The unique stock keeping unit used to identify the Product Variant. This will usually be a unique identifer for the item that is to be shipped, and can be referenced across multiple systems.

barcode.description: A generic field for a GTIN number that can be used to identify the Product Variant.

ean.description: An EAN barcode number that can be used to identify the Product Variant.

upc.description: A UPC barcode number that can be used to identify the Product Variant.

inventory_quantity.description: The current quantity of the item that is stocked.

allow_backorder.description: Whether the Product Variant should be purchasable when `inventory_quantity` is 0.

manage_inventory.description: Whether Medusa should manage inventory for the Product Variant.

hs_code.description: The Harmonized System code of the Product Variant. May be used by Fulfillment Providers to pass customs information to shipping carriers.

origin_country.description: The country in which the Product Variant was produced. May be used by Fulfillment Providers to pass customs information to shipping carriers.

mid_code.description: The Manufacturers Identification code that identifies the manufacturer of the Product Variant. May be used by Fulfillment Providers to pass customs information to shipping carriers.

material.description: The material and composition that the Product Variant is made of, May be used by Fulfillment Providers to pass customs information to shipping carriers.

weight.description: The weight of the Product Variant. May be used in shipping rate calculations.

length.description: The length of the Product Variant. May be used in shipping rate calculations.

height.description: The height of the Product Variant. May be used in shipping rate calculations.

width.description: The width of the Product Variant. May be used in shipping rate calculations.

options.description: The details of the product options that this product variant defines values for.

inventory_items.description: The details inventory items of the product variant.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

deleted_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was deleted.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

purchasable.description:
Only used with the inventory modules.
A boolean value indicating whether the Product Variant is purchasable.
A variant is purchasable if:
  - inventory is not managed
  - it has no inventory items
  - it is in stock
  - it is backorderable.

ProductVariantInventoryItem.title: Product Variant Inventory Item
ProductVariantInventoryItem.description: A Product Variant Inventory Item links variants with inventory items and denotes the required quantity of the variant.

id.description: The product variant inventory item's ID

inventory_item_id.description: The id of the inventory item

variant.description: The details of the product variant.

required_quantity.description: The quantity of an inventory item required for the variant.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

deleted_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was deleted.

PublishableApiKey.title: Publishable API key
PublishableApiKey.description: A Publishable API key defines scopes that resources are available in. Then, it can be used in request to infer the resources without having to directly pass them. For example, a publishable API key can be associated with one or more sales channels. Then, when the publishable API key is passed in the header of a request, it is inferred what sales channel is being used without having to pass the sales channel as a query or body parameter of the request. Publishable API keys can only be used with sales channels, at the moment.

created_by.description: The unique identifier of the user that created the key.

revoked_by.description: The unique identifier of the user that revoked the key.

revoked_at.description: The date with timezone at which the key was revoked.

title.description: The key's title.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

PublishableApiKeySalesChannel.title: Publishable API Key Sales Channel
PublishableApiKeySalesChannel.description: This represents the association between the Publishable API keys and Sales Channels

Refund.title: Refund
Refund.description: A refund represents an amount of money transfered back to the customer for a given reason. Refunds may occur in relation to Returns, Swaps and Claims, but can also be initiated by an admin for an order.

order_id.description: The ID of the order this refund was created for.

order.description: The details of the order this refund was created for.

payment.description: The details of the payment associated with the refund.

amount.description: The amount that has be refunded to the Customer.

note.description: An optional note explaining why the amount was refunded.

reason.description: The reason given for the Refund, will automatically be set when processed as part of a Swap, Claim or Return.

idempotency_key.description: Randomly generated key used to continue the completion of the refund in case of failure.

externalDocs.description: Learn more how to use the idempotency key.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

Region.title: Region
Region.description: A region holds settings specific to a geographical location, including the currency, tax rates, and fulfillment and payment providers. A Region can consist of multiple countries to accomodate common shopping settings across countries.

name.description: The name of the region as displayed to the customer. If the Region only has one country it is recommended to write the country name.

currency_code.description: The three character currency code used in the region.

externalDocs.description: See a list of codes.

currency.description: The details of the currency used in the region.

tax_rate.description: The tax rate that should be charged on purchases in the Region.

tax_rates.description: The details of the tax rates used in the region, aside from the default rate.

tax_code.description: The tax code used on purchases in the Region. This may be used by other systems for accounting purposes.

gift_cards_taxable.description: Whether the gift cards are taxable or not in this region.

automatic_taxes.description: Whether taxes should be automated in this region.

countries.description: The details of the countries included in this region.

tax_provider_id.description: The ID of the tax provider used in this region

tax_provider.description: The details of the tax provider used in the region.

payment_providers.description: The details of the payment providers that can be used to process payments in the region.

fulfillment_providers.description: The details of the fulfillment providers that can be used to fulfill items of orders and similar resources in the region.

includes_tax.description: Whether the prices for the region include tax

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

deleted_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was deleted.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

ReservationItemDTO.title: Reservation item
ReservationItemDTO.description: Represents a reservation of an inventory item at a stock location

id.description: The id of the reservation item

location_id.description: The id of the location of the reservation

inventory_item_id.description: The id of the inventory item the reservation relates to

created_by.description: UserId of user who created the reservation item

quantity.description: The id of the reservation item

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

deleted_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was deleted.

available_quantity.description: The available quantity in the inventory location.

Return.title: Return
Return.description: A Return holds information about Line Items that a Customer wishes to send back, along with how the items will be returned. Returns can also be used as part of a Swap or a Claim.

items.description: The details of the items that the customer is returning.

swap_id.description: The ID of the swap that the return may belong to.

swap.description: The details of the swap that the return may belong to.

claim_order_id.description: The ID of the claim that the return may belong to.

claim_order.description: The details of the claim that the return may belong to.

order_id.description: The ID of the order that the return was created for.

order.description: The details of the order that the return was created for.

shipping_method.description: The details of the Shipping Method that will be used to send the Return back. Can be null if the Customer will handle the return shipment themselves.

shipping_data.description: Data about the return shipment as provided by the Fulfilment Provider that handles the return shipment.

location_id.description: The ID of the stock location the return will be added back.

refund_amount.description: The amount that should be refunded as a result of the return.

no_notification.description: When set to true, no notification will be sent related to this return.

idempotency_key.description: Randomly generated key used to continue the completion of the return in case of failure.

externalDocs.description: Learn more how to use the idempotency key.

received_at.description: The date with timezone at which the return was received.

created_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was created.

updated_at.description: The date with timezone at which the resource was updated.

metadata.description: An optional key-value map with additional details

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

ReturnItem.title: Return Item
ReturnItem.description: A return item represents a line item in an order that is to be returned. It includes details related to the return and the reason behind it.

return_id.description: The ID of the Return that the Return Item belongs to.

item_id.description: The ID of the Line Item that the Return Item references.

return_order.description: Details of the Return that the Return Item belongs to.

item.description: The details of the line item in the original order to be returned.

quantity.description: The quantity of the Line Item to be returned.

is_requested.description: Whether the Return Item was requested initially or received unexpectedly in the warehouse.

requested_quantity.description: The quantity that was originally requested to be returned.

received_quantity.description: The quantity that was received in the warehouse.

reason_id.description: The ID of the reason for returning the item.

ShippingMethod.description: A Shipping Method represents a way in which an Order or Return can be shipped. If the shipping method is created for a return, it may be associated with a claim or a swap that the return is part of.

ShippingOption.title: Shipping Option
ShippingOption.description: A Shipping Option represents a way in which an Order or Return can be shipped. Shipping Options have an associated Fulfillment Provider that will be used when the fulfillment of an Order is initiated. Shipping Options themselves cannot be added to Carts, but serve as a template for Shipping Methods. This distinction makes it possible to customize individual Shipping Methods with additional information.

cookie_auth.name: connect.sid
cookie_auth.description:
Use a cookie session to send authenticated requests.

### How to Obtain the Cookie Session

If you're sending requests through a browser, using JS Client, or using tools like Postman, the cookie session should be automatically set when the customer is logged in.

If you're sending requests using cURL, you must set the Session ID in the cookie manually.

To do that, send a request to [authenticate the customer](#tag/Auth/operation/PostAuth) and pass the cURL option `-v`:

```bash
curl -v --location --request POST 'https://medusa-url.com/store/auth' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data-raw '{
  "email": "user@example.com",
  "password": "supersecret"
}'
```

The headers will be logged in the terminal as well as the response. You should find in the headers a Cookie header similar to this:

```bash
Set-Cookie: connect.sid=s%3A2Bu8BkaP9JUfHu9rG59G16Ma0QZf6Gj1.WT549XqX37PN8n0OecqnMCq798eLjZC5IT7yiDCBHPM;
```

Copy the value after `connect.sid` (without the `;` at the end) and pass it as a cookie in subsequent requests as the following:

```bash
curl --location --request GET 'https://medusa-url.com/store/customers/me/orders' \
--header 'Cookie: connect.sid={sid}'
```

Where `{sid}` is the value of `connect.sid` that you copied.
